questions.text: Does ContextManager's cache key (used for parse results, sections, skills, system prompt) intentionally ignore the incoming user message, request.args, and custom sections?

How are token budgets computed and enforced end-to-end: SectionSelector limits sections to 40% of maxTokens, but compaction and pruning thresholds also target 80%/protectWindowâ€”are these budgets coordinated or duplicated?
When request overrides (maxTokens, mode, techStack, compressionThreshold) are supplied, which source takes precedence when building the context and updating the session?
Are there automated tests that cover the expected invariants for cache key composition, budget limits, compaction/pruning thresholds, and session/request parameter precedence?

notes: Questions derived from the context-scan observations and will guide targeted file analysis.
